@kaiynne And after a year or so, if token utility/reasons to hold is still weak, whatâ€™s the incentive to stick w the protocol as opposed to dumping unlocked tokens + seeking work from the next new hot protocol who will give you the same deal (12 month cliffs + lots of tokens)?

@kaiynne Agree lock ups help force holding in the short/midterm (12-36 months), but itâ€™s not that long of a time in grand scheme, especially for the more complex protocols that will take 6-24 months to get off their V1/alpha versions.

@kaiynne Itâ€™s also important to continue finding ways to deliver longer term token utility/reasons to hold the tokens. If itâ€™s just a race to earn/dump, whatâ€™s the incentive for a talented engineer to hold/maintain interest vs just dumping/earning coins from the next hot protocol?
